description.en: We will cover prosodic/phonological features, then morphology and morphophonology in the major word classes, then look at syntactic structures, and finally use this knowledge to analyze spoken and written Pite Saami texts. Some basic language skills and insights into language community contexts will also be covered.
description.et: Käsitleme prosoodilisi/fonoloogilisi tunnuseid, morfoloogiat ja morfofonoloogiat põhilistes sõnaklassides. Vaatleme süntaktilisi struktuure ja lõpuks kasutame neid teadmisi suulise ja kirjaliku Pite saami tekstide analüüsimiseks. Samuti käsitleme mõningaid põhilisi keeleoskusi ja arusaamu keelekogukonna kontekstidest.

objectives.en: This course provides a synchronic overview of grammatical structures in Pite Saami (phonology, morphology and syntax)
objectives.et: See kursus annab sünkroonse ülevaate Pite saami keele grammatilistest struktuuridest (fonoloogia, morfoloogia ja süntaks)

learning_outcomes.en: Students will acquire knowledge of the language's structure and the context it is spoken in and be able to analyze Pite Saami texts, and use this knowledge to better understand, compare and contrast other Saamic and Uralic grammatical structures.

notes.et: The languages of instruction is English, but German, Hungarian, Finnish, Swedish are potentially useful, too.

independent_work.et: Independent reading of academic texts, review of slides and other class materials, presentation of linguistic structures in class, completion of homework (mostly worksheets)

grade_preconditions.et:
- not more than 3 unexcused absences
- complete all homework assignments

A.et:
Participation: active, regular participation in class discussions; regular attendance; thorough, close reading of literature assignments and homework worksheets; insightful, relevant questions and comments in class
Exam: 90-100% of possible points

B.et:
Participation: active, regular participation in class discussions; regular attendance; thorough reading of literature assignments and homework worksheets; relevant questions and comments in class
Exam: 80-89% of possible points

C.et:
Participation: active, somewhat irregular participation in class discussions; somewhat regular attendance; reading of literature assignments and completion of homework worksheets; somewhat relevant questions and comments in class
Exam: 70-79% of possible points

D.et:
Participation: irregular participation in class discussions; irregular attendance; sporadic reading of literature assignments and completion of homework worksheets; occasional questions and comments in class
Exam: 60-69% of possible points

E.et:
Participation: -no participation in class discussions; irregular attendance; insufficient reading of literature assignments and completion of homework worksheets; rare or no questions and comments in class
Exam: 50-59% of possible points

F.et:
Participation: no participation in class discussions; more than 3 absences; no reading of literature assignments; no completion of homework worksheets; no questions or comments in class
Exam: less than 50% of possible points
